sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>thread</radical> on this <radical>football</radical> is <kanji>loose</kanji>. We need to tighten up the loose thread on this football or it’s gonna fall apart while we’re playing.
meaningInfo: Look at this football. The thread is loose on the football and needs to be tightened. Attempt to tighten the loose thread on the football as you hold it in your hands.
readingMnemonic: You finally tighten the <kanji>loose</kanji> thread and all of your friends cheer, “<reading>You ru</reading>le!” (<ja>ゆる</ja>) You rule because you fixed the loose thread on the football and now you can play again. Yeah! You rule, man!
readingInfo: Listen to your friends shouting “You rule!” and hear their cheers echo in your ears as you toss the football around again.
